parse.title: List of monuments and memorials to Christopher Columbus

text.*:
See also: Monument and memorial controversies in the United States § Christopher Columbus
See also: Indigenous Peoples' Day
Statue in Alexandria, Egypt
For more information, see the Columbus Memorial Pages, which list 600 monuments.

This is a list of monuments and memorials to Christopher Columbus.

Holidays[edit]

Main article: Columbus Day
  • Argentina
    • The holiday was changed from El día de la Raza (The Day of the Race) (1916) to "Day of Respect of Cultural Diversity" in 2010.
  • Columbia
    • El día de la Raza y de la Hispanidad
  • Costa Rica
    • The holiday was changed from Día de la Raza to Día del Encuentro de las Culturas(Day of the Encounter of Cultures).
  • United States
    • Columbus Day
  • Venezuela.
    • The holiday was changed from El día de la Raza (The Day of the Race) (1921) Día de la Resistencia Indígena (Day of Indigenous Resistance) in 2002

Monuments[edit]

Argentina[edit]

  • Ayacucho
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1895)[1]
  • Bernal
    • Estatua de Cristóbal Colón (Statue of Christopher Columbus) (1889)[2]
  • Buenos Aires
    • Hommaje de Billiken a Colón (Monolith for Columbus)[3]
    • Cristóbal Colón 'en las Americas' (Christopher Columbus 'in the Americas') (1992)[4]
    • Busto de Cristóbal Colón (Bust of Columbus) (1884)[5]
    • Monumento a Cristóbal Colón (Columbus Monument) (1921)[6]
    • Monumento a Colón en Liniers (Columbus Monument in Liniers) (1921)[7]
  • Chivilcoy
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1892)[8]
  • Colón
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1953)[9]
  • Córdoba
    • Medallón con retrato en relieve de Colón (Relief portrait medaillon of Columbus)(1930)[10]
  • Gaiman
    • Monumento a Cristóbal Colón (Columbus Monument) (1892)[11]
  • General Roca
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1929)[12]
  • La Plata
    • Monumento a Cristóbal Colón (Columbus Monument)[13]
  • Laboulaye
    • Monumento de españoles e italianos (Monument of Spanish and Italians) (1965)[14]
  • Mar del Plata
    • Estatua de Cristóbal Colón (Statue of Christopher Columbus)[15]
  • Mendoza
    • Monumento a la Hermandad Hispano-Argentina (1947)[16]
  • Monte Caseros
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1892)[17]
  • Salta
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1986)[18]
  • San Carlos de Bariloche
    • Cristobal Colón llega a América (Columbus reaches America) (1947)[19]
  • Santa Fe
    • Monumento a Cristóbal Colón (Columbus Monument) (1940s)[20]
  • Santa Teresita
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1992)[21]
  • Villaguay
    • Busto de Cristóbal Colón (Bust of Columbus)[22]

Belgium[edit]

  • Brussels
    • The Barcelona Monument to Columbus is reproduced in miniature scale in the miniature park Mini-Europe.

Bolivia[edit]

  • La Paz
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1920)[23]

Brazil[edit]

  • Muçum
    • Cristóvão Colombo (Christopher Columbus) (1925)[24]
  • Rio de Janeiro
    • Cristóvão Colombo (Christopher Columbus)[25]
  • Santa Rosa
    • Cristóvão Colombo (Christopher Columbus) (1925)[26]
  • Santos
    • Homenagem ao Descobrimento da América (Monument for the Discovery of America) (1992)[27]
  • São Paulo
    • Cristóvão Colombo (Christopher Columbus)[28]

Canada[edit]

  • Fredericton
    • Columbus Quincentennial Flagpole (1992)[29]
  • Montréal
    • Buste de Christophe Colombe (Bust of Columbus) (1976)[30]
  • Oromocto
    • Columbus Quincentennial Flagpole (1992)[31]
  • Regina
    • Model Santa Maria (1992)[32]
  • Toronto
    • Christopher Columbus Statue (1985)[33]
  • Vancouver
    • Colombo giovinetto (The First Inspiration of the Boy Columbus) (1870)[34]

Chile[edit]

  • Arica
    • Busto de Cristóbal Colón (Bust of Columbus) (1910)[35]
  • Iquique
    • Busto de Cristóbal Colón (Bust of Columbus) (1982)[36]
  • Santiago de Chile
    • Busto de Cristóbal Colón (Bust of Columbus) (1892 or earlier)[37]
    • 500th anniversary (1992)[38]
  • Valparaiso
    • Cristóbal Colón en la Avenida Brasil (Statue of Columbus on the Avenida Brasil) (1877)[39]
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1986)[40]

Colombia[edit]

  • Barranquilla
    • Estatua de Cristóbal Colón (Statue of Columbus) (1910)[41]
    • Busto de Cristóbal Colón (Bust of Columbus) (1979)[42]
  • Bogotá
    • Monumento a la Reina Isabel y Cristobal Colón (Monument for Queen Isabella and Columbus) (1906)[43]
  • Cartegena
    • Christopher Columbus Monument (1895)[44]

Costa Rica[edit]

  • Puerto Limón
    • Cristóbal y Hernando Colón (Christopher and Hernando Columbus) (1992)[45]
  • San José
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1960)[46]

Cuba[edit]

  • Baracoa
    • Cruz de Parra[47]
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus)[48]
  • Bayamo
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1892)[49]
  • Cárdenas
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1862)[50]
  • Cayo Bariay
    • Encounter of cultures (1992)[51]
  • Colón
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1892)[52]
  • Guardalavaca (Banes)
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus)[53]
  • La Habana
    • Tumba de Colón (Columbus' Tomb)[54]
    • Busto de Colón en la puerta del Cementerio de Colón (Bust of Columbus on the gate of Columbus' Cemetery) (1880)[55]
    • Estatua de Colón en el Museo de la Ciudad (Statue of Columbus on the City Museum) (1862)[56]
    • Busto de Colón en el Museo de la Revolución (Bust of Columbus in the Museum of the Revolution) (1928)[57]
    • Busto de Colón en el Templete (Bust of Columbus in the Templete) (1828)[58]
  • Matanzas
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus)[59]
  • Santiago de Cuba
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus)[60]

Dominican Republic[edit]

  • Santo Domingo
    • Columbus Lighthouse (Faro a Colón, 1992). Museum, not a lighthouse, containing Columbus’ alleged remains.

Ecuador[edit]

  • Quito
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus)[61]

Egypt[edit]

  • Alexandria
    • Christopher Columbus Statue[62]

El Salvador[edit]

  • San Salvador
    • Cristóbal Colón y la reina Isabel (Statues of Columbus and Queen Isabella) (1924)[63]

Guatemala[edit]

  • Guatemala City
    • Monumento a Colón (Columbus Monument) (1896)[64]
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus)[65]
  • Salcajá
    • Cruz de Colón (Columbus cross)[66]

Haiti[edit]

  • Port-au-Prince
    • Christophe Colomb (Christopher Columbus). Statue removed in 1987.[67]

Honduras[edit]

  • Comayagüela
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1892)[68]
  • Trujillo
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus)[69]

Italy[edit]

  • Abano Terme
    • Cristoforo Colombo (Christopher Columbus) (1956)[70]
  • Bettola
    • Lapide commemorativa del 400° anniversario (Plaque 400th anniversary) (1892)[71]
    • Cristoforo Colombo (Statue of Christopher Columbus) (1892)[72]
    • Lapidi sulla Torre Colombo (Plaques on the Torre Colombo) (1957)[73]
  • Bistagno
    • Colombo giovinetto (The First Inspiration of the Boy Columbus) (1870)[74]
  • Chiavari
    • Cristoforo Colombo (Statue of Christopher Columbus) (1935)[75]
  • Chiusanico
    • Caravella nel marciapiede (Caravel Pavement) (1992)[76]
    • Casa Colombo (Columbus' House)[77]
    • Lapide del'origine della famiglia di Colombo (Plaque Origin Columbus' Family) (1967)[78]
    • Busto di Cristoforo Colombo (Bust of Columbus)[79]
  • Cicagna
    • Cristoforo Colombo (Statue of Christopher Columbus) (1892)[80]
  • Cogoleto
    • Lapide sulla chiesa Sta. Maria (Plaque on the church) (1888)[81]
    • Lapide commemorativa della visita de Princetown nel 1847 (Plaque visit Princetown in 1847) (1888)[82]
    • Monumento a Cristoforo Colombo (Columbus monument) (1864)[83]
    • Ritratto e le scene della vita di Colombo (Columbus portrait and life scenes) (1992)[84]
    • Affresco sulla casa natale di Colombo (Fresco on Columbus' birth house) (1650)[85]
    • Lapide commemorativa della visita di re Umberto I nel 1857 (Plaque visit King Umberto in 1857) (1888)[86]
    • Cogoleto Municipio (Portrait and ship model at Cogoleto town hall)[87]
  • Cuccaro Monferrato
    • Monumento del 500° anniversario (500th anniversary monument) (1992)[88]
    • Lapide commemorativa del 500° anniversario (Plaque 500th anniversary) (1992)[89]
    • Lapide commemorativa del dinastia di Colombo (Plaque for the Colombo dynasty) (1992)[90]
  • Diano Marina
    • Cristoforo Colombo (Statue of Christopher Columbus) (1892)[91]
  • Fontanarossa (Piacenza)
    • Lapide sulla casa natale di madre di Colombo (Plaque birth place Columbus' mother, Susanna Fontanarossa) (1958)[92]
  • Genova
    • La Vela di Columbo (The Sail of Columbus) (1998[93])[94]
    • Marciapiede Campopisano (Campopisano Pavement) (1992)[95]
    • Rilievi del Castello D'Albertis (Reliefs in the Castello D'Albertis) (1892)[96]
    • Colombo giovinetto (The First Inspiration of the Boy Columbus) (1870)[97]
    • Il Bigo (The Mast) (1992)[98]
    • Lapide sulla Palazzo di San Giorgio (Plaque on the San Giorgio Palace) (1951)[99]
    • Affresco sulla facciata del Palazzo di San Giorgio (Fresco on the façade of the San Giorgio Palace)[93]
    • Busto di Cristoforo Colombo nel Palazzo Reale (Bust of Columbus) (1864)[100]
    • Monumento a Colombo nel Palazzo Rosso (Columbus Monument in the Palazzo Rosso) (1851)[101]
    • Monumento a Colombo in Piazza Acquaverde (Columbus Monument on Piazza Acquaverde) (1846)
      Columbus Monument on Piazza Acquaverde
      [102]
    • Rilievi su Piazza Dante (Reliefs on Piazza Dante)[103]
    • Busto di Cristoforo Colombo nel Palazzo della Regione (Bust of Columbus in the Regione Liguria Palace) (1934)[104]
    • Giardini di Colombo (Columbus gardens)[105]
    • Ritratto di Colombo con le navi (Columbus Portrait with ships) (1984)[106]
    • Busto di Cristoforo Colombo nel Stazione Marittima (Bust of Columbus in the Stazione Marittima)[107]
    • La Nave Umana (Human Ship) (1992)[108]
    • Statua di Cristoforo Colombo nel Liceo Colombo (Statue of Columbus in the Columbus school) (1892)[109]
    • Busto di Cristoforo Colombo nel Palazzo Tursi (Bust of Columbus in the Palazzo Tursi) (1821)[110]
    • Statua di Cristoforo Colombo in Via Gramsci (Statue of Columbus in the Via Gramsci) (1850)[111]
    • Casa de Colombo (Columbus' House)[112]
  • La Spezia
    • Due statue di Cristoforo Colombo (Two Statues of Columbus)[113]
  • Lavagna
    • Cristoforo Colombo (Statue of Christopher Columbus) (1930)[114]
  • Lucca
    • San Michele e 35 protomi di figure storiche (Saint Michael and 35 protomes of historical figures)[115]
  • Milano
    • Statua di Cristoforo Colombo (Statue of Christopher Columbus) (19th century)[116]
    • Busto di Cristoforo Colombo (Bust of Christopher Columbus) (1900)[117]
  • Mirandola
    • Medaglioni ritratto di illustri italiani (Portrait medaillons of famous Italians)[118]
  • Moconesi
    • Affresco con Colombo, Dante e Petrarca (Fresco showing Columbus, Dante and Petrarca)[119]
    • La Casa degli Avi di Colombo(Columbus Ancestral house)[120]
    • Scultura commemorativa di Colombo (Sculpture commemorating Columbus) (1979)[121]
    • Lapide commemorativa de 1889 (Memorial plaque of 1889) (1889)[122]
    • Lapide commemorativa del 500° anniversario (Plaque 500th Anniversary) (1992)[123]
  • Noli
    • Commemorazione della partenza di Colombo da Genova nel 1476 (Commemoration Columbus departure from Genoa in 1476) (1948)[124]
  • Ovada
    • Ritratto di Cristoforo Colombo (Portrait of Columbus) (1992)[125]
  • Parma
    • Colombo giovinetto (The First Inspiration of the Boy Columbus) (1870)[126]
  • Pavia
    • Busto di Cristoforo Colombo (Bust of Columbus) (1882)[127]
  • Rapallo
    • Affresco di Colombo e altri illustri italiani (Fresco of Columbus and other famous Italians)[128]
    • Cristoforo Colombo (Christopher Columbus) (1914)[129]
  • Roma
    • Busto di Cristoforo Colombo (Bust of Columbus) (1817)[130]
  • San Colombano Certenoli
    • Cristoforo Colombo (Christopher Columbus) (1992)[131]
  • Santa Margherita Ligure
    • Cristoforo Colombo (Christopher Columbus) (1892)[132]
  • Santo Stefano d'Aveto
    • Ritratto di Colombo (Portrait of Columbus)[133]
  • Savona
    • Busto di Cristoforo Colombo (Bust of Christopher Columbus) (1928)[134]
    • Commemorativa sulla casa del padre di Colombo (Memorial on the house of Columbus' father) (1940)[135]
    • Commemorativa in Via San Giuliano (Columbus memorial in the Via San Giuliano) (1892)[136]
  • Sestri Levante
    • Vela per Cristoforo Colombo (Christopher Columbus's Sail) (2002)[137]
  • Torino
    • Ritratto di Colombo (Portrait of Columbus) (1923)[138]

Jamaica[edit]

  • Discovery Bay
    • Cross at Columbus' Landing[139]
  • St. Ann's Bay
    • New Seville Plaque[140]
    • Christopher Columbus Statue[141]

Japan[edit]

  • Shima, Mie
    • A reproduction of the Barcelona monument is found in the Shima Spanish Village.

Nicaragua[edit]

  • Managua
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus)[142]

Panama[edit]

  • Colón
    • Monumento a Cristóbal Colón (1867)[143]

Paraguay[edit]

  • Asunción
    • Busto de Cristóbal Colón (Bust of Columbus)[144]

Peru[edit]

  • Callao
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus)[145]
  • Cuzco
    • Placa conmemorativa de la resistencia andina (Plaque for Andean resistance) (1992)[146]
  • Lima
    • Monumento a Cristóbal Colón (Columbus Monument) (1867)[147]
  • Pisco
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus)[148]
  • Tacna
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1892)[149]

Portugal[edit]

  • Cuba
    • Cristóvão Colombo (Christopher Columbus) (2006)[150]
    • Cristóvão Colombo (Christopher Columbus) (2010)[151]
  • Funchal
    • Regata "América 500" (1992)[152]
    • Cristóvão Colombo (Christopher Columbus) (1940)[153]* Lisboa
    • Mural mostrando os Descobrimentos Português (Mural showing Portuguese Discoveries) (1994)[154]
  • Vila Baleira (Ilha do Porto Santo)
    • Cristóvão Colombo (Christopher Columbus) (1989)[155]
  • Vila do Porto
    • Cristóvão Colombo (Christopher Columbus) (1992)[156]

Spain[edit]

  • Barcelona
    • Columbus Monument, Barcelona (1888). Called in Spanish “Mirador de Colón”, because it can be ascended internally to viewing windows.At the foot there are “various combinations of sculptures related to the discovery of America”.[157]
  • L'Arboç, Tarragona
    • There is a reproduction of the Barcelona monument (statue only) in mahogany wood, on top of building Les Amériques.[158]
  • Maspalomas, Gran Canaria
    • Reproduction of Barcelona monument
  • Torrelles de Llobregat
    • Miniature reproduction of Barcelona monument

United States[edit]

Maryland[edit]

  • Baltimore
    • Columbus Obelisk (1792). Destroyed by vandals in 2017, who posted a YouTube video of themselves doing so.

Massachusetts[edit]

  • Boston
    • Statue of Columbus (1979)

New York[edit]

  • New York City, Manhattan
    • Columbus Circle (1892)
    • Statue in Central Park. In September, 2017, the hands were defaced with red paint, and the hashtag #somethingscoming and “Hate will not be tolerated” were written on the pedestal.[159]
  • Yonkers, New York
    • Statue decapitated in 2017.[160]

Pennsylvania[edit]

  • Bethlehem
    • Memorial to Admiral Christopher Columbus (1992)[161]
  • Bristol
    • Bust of Christopher Columbus (1992)[162]
  • Bryn Mawr
    • Bust of Christopher Columbus (1952)[163]
  • Carbondale
    • Bust of Christopher Columbus (1959)[164]
  • Chester
    • Christopher Columbus Statue (1955)[165]
  • Conshohocken
    • Bust of Christopher Columbus (1970)[166]
  • Easton
    • Christopher Columbus Statue (1930)[167]
  • Hazleton
    • Christopher Columbus Statue (1952)[168]
  • Lancaster
    • Bust of Christopher Columbus (1992)[169]
  • Norristown
    • Hello Columbus Monument (1992)[170]
  • Philadelphia
    • Christopher Columbus Marble Sculpture[171]
    • Christopher Columbus Monument (1876)[172]
    • Columbus Obelisk (1992)[173]
    • Bust of Christopher Columbus (1920)[174]
  • Pittsburgh
    • Christopher Columbus Statue (1958)[175]
  • Pittston
    • Christopher Columbus Statue (1969)[176]
  • Scranton
    • Christopher Columbus Monument (1892)[177][178]

Puerto Rico[edit]

  • Arecibo
    • "Birth of a New World," a 268 feet (82 m) tall bronze and steel statue (2016).[179]

Uruguay[edit]

  • Durazno
    • Monumento a Colón (Columbus Monument) (1892)[180]
  • Montevideo
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1927)[181]

Venezuela[edit]

  • Caracas
    • Cristóbal Colón en el Parque El Calvario (Christopher Columbus in the El Calvario Park) (1893)[182]
    • Monumento a Colón en el Golfo triste (Christopher Columbus in the Golfo Triste)(1904)[183]
  • Carúpano
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1892)[184]
  • Macuro
    • Cristóbal Colón (Christopher Columbus) (1974)[185]
  • Mérida
    • Busto de Cristóbal Colón (Bust of Columbus) (1895)[186]
  • Mucuchachí
    • Busto de Cristóbal Colón (Bust of Columbus) (1930?)[187]

Places[edit]

Main article: List of places named for Christopher Columbus

Canada[edit]

  • British Columbia, province (1792)[188]

South America[edit]

  • Colombia and the earlier Greater Colombia, country of South America.
  • Colin, Panama, city
  • Colón (Panamanian province)
  • Colombo (Brazilian municipality in the state of Parana, Brazil)

Southeast Asia[edit]

  • Colombo, former capital of Sri Lanka (altered by the Portuguese from similar-sounding native name)
  • Colon Street, Cebu, Philippines

United States[edit]

At least 54 U.S. communities are named for Christopher Columbus.[189]

  • Columbia, Maryland, city[189]
  • Columbia, Missouri, city[189]
  • Columbia, South Carolina, city (1786)[188][189]
  • Columbus, Georgia, city[189]
  • Columbus, Indiana, city[189]
  • Columbus, Mississippi, city[189]
  • Columbus, Nebraska, city[189]
  • Columbus, Texas, city[189]
  • Columbus, Wisconsin, city[189]
  • Columbus, Montana[189]
  • Columbus, Ohio (1812)[188][189]
  • District of Columbia (1791)[188][189]
  • Columbiana County, Ohio[189]
  • Columbiana, Ohio, city[189]
  • Columbia County, New York[189]
  • Columbia County, Pennsylvania[189]
  • Columbia County, Wisconsin[189]
  • Columbus Circle, New York City[189]

Schools[edit]

United States[edit]

  • Columbia University (1784)[188]
